alert.note: Alert for Catahoula; Concordia; Tensas (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 7:37PM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT TENSAS...NORTHERN CONCORDIA AND EAST CENTRAL CATAHOULA PARISHES...WESTERN CLAIBORNE...NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON AND NORTH CENTRAL ADAMS COUNTIES THROUGH 830 PM CST... At 737 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Newellton to Cooter Point to Jonesville. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Jonesville, Newellton, Helena, Wildsville, Lee Bayou, and Cooter Point around 740 PM CST. Clayton and Lake Bruin around 745 PM CST. Waterproof and Frogmore around 750 PM CST. Ferriday and St. Joseph around 755 PM CST. Spokane around 800 PM CST. Natchez around 805 PM CST. Ridgecrest around 810 PM CST. Alcorn State around 815 PM CST. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CST for northeastern Louisiana...and southwestern and west central Mississippi.
